meanings.definition: A person who inherits or is entitled to inherit property or a title from someone else.
meanings.sent1: The inheritors of the estate were overjoyed to receive their grandfather's antique watch.
meanings.sent2: The siblings were the inheritors of their parents' successful business.
meanings.sent3: The inheritors of the treasure chest were surprised to find it filled with chocolate coins.
meanings.sent4: As the inheritors of the family legacy, they felt the weight of responsibility on their shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The inheritors eagerly awaited the reading of the will to discover their fate.

meanings.definition: Those who receive or are entitled to receive something from a predecessor.
meanings.sent1: The inheritors of the scholarship were grateful for the opportunity to further their education.
meanings.sent2: The new team members were the inheritors of the successful project started by their predecessors.
meanings.sent3: The inheritors of the secret recipe were thrilled to continue the tradition of making the famous dish.
meanings.sent4: The inheritors of the ancient tradition carried on the customs of their ancestors with pride.
meanings.sent5: The inheritors of the family heirloom cherished the sentimental value it held.
